channel.title: BitDevs C√≥rdoba
channel.description: BitDevs C√≥rdoba es una comunidad en el √°rea de C√≥rdoba Capital para aquellos interesados en discutir y participar en la investigaci√≥n y desarrollo de Bitcoin y protocolos relacionados.

item.title: Seminario Socr√°tico #9
item.author: Unknown
item.description:
Agenda

18:30hs Previa
19:00hs Seminario Socr√°tico donde revisamos m√∫ltiples temas relacionados con Bitcoin
20:00hs Cierre

Ubicaci√≥n

El evento se organiza dentro del espacio de Bitcoin School Argentina:

Bv. Chacabuco 625
1¬∫ piso, Sal√≥n Principal
C√≥rdoba, Argentina X5000

Map

Anuncios

Bienvenidos a nuestro Seminario Socr√°tico! Un especial agradecimiento a nuestros sponsors: Bitcoin School Argentina por el espacio y a B4OS por las bebidas y el soporte t√©cnico.

Recordatorios

  • No se permiten fotograf√≠as, v√≠deos o grabaciones de audio
  • Nos adherimos a "the Chatham House Rule"

Bajo estas reglas, cualquier participante del encuentro es libre de usar la informacion adquirida en la discusi√≥n, pero no esta permitido revelar quien hizo ningun comentario en particular. El objetivo es incrementar la apertura del debate.

  • Deja el espacio del encuentro tan limpio como lo encontraste.
  • Sugiere temas para el siguiente Seminario Socr√°tico! ¬øD√≥nde encontrar temas para futuros seminarios?

Oportunidades educativas o laborales

  • Bitcoiner Jobs
  • Summer of Bitcoin
  • B4OS
  • Chaincode Labs: Bitcoin and Lightning Protocol Development Education

Estad√≠sticas de la Red

  • mempool.space
  • clarkmoody.com
  • utxo.live
  • bitcointreasuries.net
  • stratum.work
  • non standard txs dataset
  • mining centralization index

Presentaci√≥n

  • Coinjoin: La Experiencia de Wasabi Wallet, por Lucas Ontivero.
CTV + CSFS:
  • What's a good stopping point? Follow-up: Design of operations to achieve CTV + CSFS
Noticias:
  • B4OS 2025
  • MIT DCI: New research network
  • Storm found guilty
  • Samourai devs found guilty
  • Harbor releases v1.0
  • Five years of the bitcoin design community
  • Protocolo Bitcoin by Edil Medeiros, from University of Brasilia
  • Labitbu Mania surge
  • Arkade: Virtual Execution Layer for Bitcoin-Native Applications
An√°lisis:
  • MIT DCI: Whirpool Analysis
  • What Network Activity Says About Changing Face of Bitcoin Users
  • Unlock bitcoin as everyday money
  • Compact block reconstruction stats
  • Ark labs: Ark explained
  • Block filter design guide
Privacidad:
  • btc++: shielded CSV to improve onchain privacy
Protocolo:
  • Non custodial ecash
  • Glock by Alpen Labs: garbled circuits for script locks on Bitcoin
  • Private access control for bitcoin keys
  • Writing programs on simplicity
  • Sharing block templates
  • Emulate soft forks using stateless TEEs
Software:
  • Weak, Slow, Key‚ÄØDerivation‚ÄØFunction
  • peer-observer:A tool and infrastructure for monitoring the Bitcoin P2P network for attacks and anomalies
  • eltord: main daemon to run tor
  • Bitcoin snapshots
  • White Noise chat
  • Bitchat

Bajo estas reglas, cualquier participante del encuentro es libre de usar la informacion adquirida en la discusi√≥n, pero no esta permitido revelar quien hizo ningun comentario en particular. El objetivo es incrementar la apertura del debate.

  • Deja el espacio del encuentro tan limpio como lo encontraste.

Presentation

  • Lucas Ontivero presents his work and researchs: Wasabi Wallet and Artificial Intelligence

Temas seleccionados

  • CTV + CSFS
  • FROST

CTV + CSFS:
  • What's a good stopping point? Making the case for the capabilities enabled by CTV+CSFS

  • Bitcoin Core developer responses to OP_CTV + OP_CSFS open letter

FROST, threshold signing protocol:
  • Spiral blog: About FROST advances by Frostpunk
  • Paper: On the Adaptive Security of FROST
Noticias:
  • OpenSats Bitcoin Developer Training Report
  • Bitcoin client comparison
An√°lisis:
  • Eric Voskuil on Bitcoin Core's UTXO Model
  • Witnessless Sync for pruned nodes

Seguridad:
  • "Denial-of-Service due to inv-to-send sets growing too large" write up
Privacidad:
  • Fingerprinting nodes via addr requests
  • On Ashigaru anonimity vulnerabilities
Protocolo:
  • BIP ?: New Opcodes for TaprootV2 by Rusty Russell
Software:
  • Bold Wallet: a seedless "warm" wallet leveraging threshold signature schemes
  • Augur: An Open Source Bitcoin Fee Estimation Library
  • Updates on bitcoinkernel library project
  • Bitcoin Core PR #32959: Reduce minrelaytxfee to 100 sats/kvB

Miner√≠a:

Cu√°ntica:

Lecturas de este mes

  • DahLIAS: Discrete Logarithm-Based Interactive Aggregate Signatures
  • OP_CAT: The Path to General Computation on Bitcoin with (OP_CAT)
  • Winternitz by Schnorr signature replacement in BitVM
  • b10c blog: Invalid mining jobs by AntPool & friends during forks

Herramientas

  • Bitscript: disection tools for Bitcoin abstractions
  • Explora: a visual Tx explorer
  • Fuzzamoto: Holistic Fuzzing for Bitcoin Protocol Implementations
  • Grid: interactive block visualization tool
  • PSBT Explorer by Unchained
  • bitcoin_payment_instructions: text parser into payment instructions
  • MistyBreez: Flutter mobile reference implementation for the Breez SDK

Hard fork lobby

  • Capitalized Bitcoin Fork for National Strategic Reserve

Seguridad

  • 5 new DoS attacks discovered on Bitcoin: Script - Repository
  • Cluster mempool partitioning attacks
  • Bitcoin address poisoning attacks
  • Bitmex blog: Bitcoin duplicate transactions
  • Satoshi's version 22.0.x: Taproot DoS bug writeup

item.title: Seminario Socr√°tico #4
item.author: Unknown
item.description:
Agenda

18:30hs Previa
19:00hs Seminario Socr√°tico donde revisamos m√∫ltiples temas relacionados con Bitcoin
20:00hs Cierre

Ubicaci√≥n

El evento se organiza dentro del espacio de Bitcoin School Argentina:

Bv. Chacabuco 625
1¬∫ piso, Sal√≥n Principal
C√≥rdoba, Argentina X5000

Map

Anuncios

Bienvenidos a nuestro Seminario Socr√°tico! Un especial agradecimiento a nuestros sponsors: Bitcoin School Argentina por el espacio y a B4OS por las bebidas y el soporte t√©cnico.

Recordatorios

  • No se permiten fotograf√≠as, v√≠deos o grabaciones de audio
  • Nos adherimos a "the Chatham House Rule"
  • Deja el espacio del encuentro tan limpio como lo encontraste.
  • Sugiere temas para el siguiente Seminario Socr√°tico! ¬øDonde encontrar temas para futuros seminarios?

Estad√≠sticas de la Red

  • mempool.space
  • clarkmoody.com
  • utxo.live
  • bitcointreasuries.net

Temas

Seleccionados

  • Sobre C++ y Rust (by @ishi0k): ¬øDeber√≠a migrarse Bitcoin Core de manera progresiva de C++ to Rust?
  • A Treatise on Bitcoin Seed Backup Device Design - x post: conclusiones sobre dise√±o √≥ptimo de dispositivos de backup por Jameson Lopp.
  • Bitcoin y Monero (by @ishi0k)¬øMonero XMR o Bitcoin BTC en 2025?
  • Against Allowing Quantum Recovery of Bitcoin por Jameson Lopp.

Historia y Filosof√≠a

  • Las ideas de Nick Szabo: The Genesis Files: With Bit Gold, Szabo Was Inches Away From Inventing Bitcoin
  • Dan Kaminsky, experto ingeniero en seguridad inform√°tica y sus ideas sobre la seguridad de bitcoin: @MiltonRodM post - @LaCryptaOk post - blog personal de Dan Kaminsky
  • The Complete Satoshi: compendio de los aportes de Satoshi Nakamoto a bitcoin entre 2008 y 2012, por el Satoshi Nakamoto Institute.

Criptograf√≠a

  • The intuition behind elliptic curve digital signatures (ECDSA)
  • Private key extraction in ECDSA upon signing a malformed input
  • The implications of Cross-Input Signature Aggregation (CISA)

Privacidad

  • Public Key Domain (by @SeverinAlexB): x post - repositorio- blog

Recursos

  • ¬øC√≥mo empezar a contribuir en un proyecto Open Source?: repositorio
  • bitcoinwiki/cryptography
  • Programmers Friendly Zero Knowledge Book.
  • Learn me a bitcoin by Greg Walker: Sitio de referencia para aprender de bitcoin desde cero o a nivel t√©cnico.
  • iancoleman.io: blog personal con desgloses t√©cnicos sobre herramientas relacionadas a bitcoin.
  • BIP 380: Referencia sobre los distintos tipos de Output Script Descriptors disponibles
  • Bitcoin Optech: newsletter de avances en el desarrollo de bitcoin.
  • DIY Bitcoin Hardware
  • Let's code a TCP/IP stack, 1: Ethernet & ARP: tutorial sobre TCP/IP (rfc).

Oportunidades educativas o laborales

  • Bitcoiner Jobs
  • Summer of Bitcoin
  • B4OS
  • Chaincode Labs: Bitcoin and Lightning Protocol Development Education

item.title: Seminario Socr√°tico #3
item.author: Unknown
item.description:
Agenda

18:30hs Previa
19:00hs Seminario Socr√°tico donde revisamos m√∫ltiples temas relacionados con Bitcoin
20:00hs Cierre

Ubicaci√≥n

El evento se organiza dentro del espacio de Bitcoin School Argentina:

Bv. Chacabuco 625
1¬∫ piso, Sal√≥n Principal
C√≥rdoba, Argentina X5000

Map

Anuncios

Bienvenidos a nuestro Seminario Socr√°tico! Un especial agradecimiento a nuestros sponsors: Bitcoin School Argentina por el espacio y a B4OS por las bebidas y el soporte t√©cnico.

Recordatorios

  • No se permiten fotograf√≠as, v√≠deos o grabaciones de audio
  • Nos adherimos a "the Chatham House Rule"
  • Deja el espacio del encuentro tan limpio como lo encontraste.
  • Sugiere temas para el siguiente Seminario Socr√°tico! ¬øDonde encontrar temas para futuros seminarios?

Estad√≠sticas de la Red

  • mempool.space
  • clarkmoody.com
  • utxo.live
  • bitcointreasuries.net

Temas

Seleccionados

  • Build your own Coinpool
  • Obscura: The First VPN That Can‚Äôt Log Your Activity (Built by Bitcoiners) | Carl Dong
  • How to make a transaction with UTXOs of different wallets with Sparrow
  • Taproot Assets on Lightning
  • Apple has pulled end-to-end iCloud encryption in the UK and removed over 135,000 'non-compliant' apps from the EU App Store.
  • MicroStrategy buys 20,356 BTC for $1.9 billion.
  • Bybit exchange lost over $1.46B worth of ETH from one of its cold wallets.
  • River: What's Driving Bitcoin Adoption
  • Nigeria freed Gambaryan in exchange for access to US financial surveillance capabilities)
  • Binance sued for $81.5 billion in Nigeria.
  • Kraken discloses 40% surge in law enforcement data requests.
  • Ark v0.5.0 protocol update introduces branch-only signing sessions and connector trees

Bitcoin Wallets & Tools

  • [Utreexo v0.3.2] a hash-based dynamic accumulator based on a Merkle forest
  • [Aqua wallet v0.2.10] includes bug fixes for amount display in USDT and a not respected minimum value in internal send.
  • [Clams v0.3] New transaction filtering system for Bitcoin/Lightning accounting
  • [Ark Wallet SDK] New TypeScript library for Bitcoin wallet development with minimal dependencies
  • [SeedSigner v0.8.5] First multilingual release (Spanish) and P2TR address verification
  • [Envoy v1.8.6] UI improvements and OpenStreetMaps integration for ATM locations
  • [Bitcoin Safe v1.0.5/1.0.6] Added restore from seed option for Bitbox02 and UI fixes
  • [BDK wallet v1.1.0] Updated transaction builder and added testnet4 support
  • [Blockstream Green v2.0.20] Added Liquid discounted fees for Confidential Transactions
  • [Nunchuk Android v1.9.60] Added Android 15 support
  • [Blitz v0.4.0-beta] Fixed balance checks and QR code improvements
  • [Dana v0.4.0] Silent Payments wallet with improved coin selection
  • [Proton Wallet] New self-custodial and encrypted Bitcoin wallet for iOS/Android/web
  • [COLDCARD Mk4 v5.4.1 & Q v1.3.1] New message signing and Delta Mode improvements
  • [Sparrow v2.1.2] Fixed transaction loading and older Ledger signing
  • [Wasabi v2.5.1] Added configurable fee estimations and exchange rates
  • [Bitcoin Keeper v2.0.1] Major redesign with Miniscript integration
  • [ZEUS Wallet v0.10.0-alpha3] is now available for testing.
  • [BlueWallet v7.1.0] Added minikeys support and PSBT fixes
  • [Bitkit v1.0.9] Added fee weather widget and BTC calculator
  • [RBG v0.12.0-beta.5] is now available for testing.

Lightning & Payments

  • [Zaprite] Launched BTCPay Server integration for combined fiat/bitcoin payments
  • [Nutshell v0.16.5] Improved Lightning fee handling in Cashu protocol implementation
  • [Iris Wallet v0.1.0] First experimental RGB protocol wallet for Lightning Network
  • [Joltz Wallet Beta] Pioneering self-custody wallet for Taproot Assets
  • [LND v0.18.5-beta] Fixed AMP invoices and Postgres performance
  • [Chantools v0.13.6] Added support for ancient LNBIG channels
  • [LNbits v1.0] Entering final testing phase
  • [Lightning Terminal v0.14.1-alpha] Updated with latest daemon versions
  • [Clams v0.4] New Exports Widget for capital gains reporting

Nostr Clients & Tools

  • [Alby v3.11.0] Added dedicated Nostr key import and new language support
  • [Notedeck v0.3.0] First public release with media support and enhanced CLI
  • [BitVid] Decentralized video sharing platform using WebTorrent and Nostr
  • [Flotilla v0.2.6] Discord-style communities platform built on Nostr
  • [Futr v0.2.0] Feature-rich Linux Nostr client with threading support
  • [Rust-nostr v0.39.0] Major SDK update with expanded protocol support
  • [Vortex v1.1] Added ecash tokens and LNURL-withdraw support
  • [Olas v0.2.0] Instagram-like client with multi-image uploads
  • [Iris.to] Added integrated Cashu wallet
  • [Kanbanstr] Added card linking and filtering features
  • [Amber v3.2.1] Improved contact list signing features
  • [Fountain v1.1.16] Added Nostr livestreams support
  • [Primal v2.1] Added NWC support and Legend Cards
  • [Immortal v0.0.9] Improved relay security
  • [Coop v0.1.0-alpha] New desktop DM client
  • [txTree] New transaction visualization tool

Infrastructure & Development

  • [umbrelOS v1.4 beta 1] Home server functionality with new file management
  • [Kernel-Node] New experimental Bitcoin node implementation in Rust
  • [Haven relay v1.0.4] Extended protocol support with NIP-40 implementation
  • [Stratum v2 Tool v0.1.1] Improved mining protocol benchmarking capabilities
  • [Electrs v0.10.9] Improved DB operations for SSDs
  • [Mempool.space] Added Stratum jobs visualization features
  • [LND v0.18.5-beta.rc1] Fixed AMP invoices and improved Postgres performance
  • [ESP-Miner v2.6.0b1] New BitaxeOS testing release
  • [UTXOracle v8] Improved price discovery up to $500k
  • [Bitcoin Inquisition v28.1] Added ephemeral dust support
  • [Blockstream Explorer API] Relaunched with open beta
  • [Elements v23.2.6] Updated sidechain platform
  • [Multisigbackup.com] New tool for encrypted k-of-n descriptors

Development Tools

  • [Cashu-ts v2.2.0] New bundling pipeline for Cashu wallet development
  • [BIP-32 library] New standalone C implementation with minimal dependencies

Cashu & Ecash

  • [Nutstash v2.0.3] Multi-mint and send-to-nostr-key functionality
  • [bullishNuts v2.0.0] Standardized on cashuB token format
  • [Cashu Dev Kit v0.6.1] New development kit release
  • [Macadamia v0.2.1] First iOS App Store release with v4 token support

Security & Privacy

  • [Coinos.io] Security breach disclosure and remediation plan
  • [GrapheneOS v2025012700] Security patches and API improvements
  • [GrapheneOS v2025020500] February security patch release
  • [SimpleX Chat v6.3.0-beta.2] Added mentions-only notifications and message expiration
  • [Obscura VPN] Released for macOS with provable privacy
  • [Tails v6.12] Security updates
  • [Arti v1.4.0] New RPC interface for Tor
  • [CalyxOS v6.4.0] Android 15 support
  • [GrapheneOS v2025021100] Latest security improvements

Mining

  • [AditBoard] New USB adapter for Bitmain hashboards
  • [Braiins] Open-sourced BCB 100 mining control board

Vulnerabilidades

  • [LDK v0.1.1] Critical patch for HTLC force closing vulnerability, users urged to update

Oportunidades educativas o laborales

  • Bitcoiner Jobs
  • Summer of Bitcoin
  • B4OS
  • Chaincode Labs: Bitcoin and Lightning Protocol Development Education

Criptograf√≠a

  • Glacius: Threshold Schnorr Signatures from DDH with Full Adaptive Security
  • Two-Round 2PC ECDSA at the Cost of 1 OLE
  • Universal Adaptor Signatures from Blackbox Multi-Party Computation
  • zkalc - calculate how much time cryptographic operations take on a real computer
  • Hash-Based Signature Schemes for Post-Quantum Bitcoin
  • BIP Draft: FROST signing

Vulnerabilidades

  • Full Disclosure: "Transaction-Relay Throughput Overflow Attacks against Off-Chain Protocols"
  • Public disclosure of one vulnerability affecting Bitcoin Core <26.0
  • Disclosure: irrevocable fees---stealing from LN using revoked commitment transactions
  • Full Disclosure: ‚ÄúTransaction-Relay Throughput Overflow attacks against Off-Chain Protocols
  • Deanonymization vulnerability affecting Wasabi and related software

Ataques

  • Slow Block Validation Attacks
  • Prevent future duplicate coinbase transactions as part of Consensus Cleanup

Auditor√≠as

  • BDK 2024 Q4 Code Audit

Wallet Backup

  • File Format for Wallet Inheritance and Recovery

Nodos

  • Boost Your Bitcoin Node Sync With UTXO Snapshots
  • Bitcoin Core on ARM (Windows)
  • Multiprocess Bitcoin Core
    • BDK Wallet PoC using multiprocess Bitcoin Core

Repositorios

Bitcoin Core
  • wallet: fix crash during watch-only wallet migration
  • Package validation: accept packages of size 1
  • rpc: Remove submitblock pre-checks
  • Improve parallel script validation error debug logging
  • dbwrapper: Bump LevelDB max file size to 32 MiB to avoid system slowdown from high disk cache flush rate
  • rpc: add getdescriptoractivity
  • policy: ephemeral dust followups
  • bench: add support for custom data directory
  • Add destroy to BlockTemplate schema
  • cluster mempool: Implement changeset interface for mempool
  • validation: fix m_best_header tracking and BLOCK_FAILED_CHILD assignment
  • benchmark: Improve SipHash_32b accuracy to avoid potential optimization issues
  • validation: Remove RECENT_CONSENSUS_CHANGE validation result
  • addrman: cap the max_pct to not exceed the maximum number of addresses
  • Ephemeral Dust
  • test: enhance p2p_orphan_handling
  • test: Add combinerawtransaction test to rpc_createmultisig
  • depends: Specify CMake generator explicitly
  • tracing: Only prepare tracepoint arguments when actually tracing
  • Remove mempoolfullrbf
  • TxDownloadManager followups
  • net: Use actual memory size in receive buffer accounting
  • netinfo: add peer services column and outbound-only option
  • init: warn, don't error, when '-upnp' is set
BDK
  • fix(electrum): prevent fetch_prev_txout from querying coinbase transactions
  • fix(tx_builder)!: make TxBuilder Send safe, remove Clone trait
  • feat(chain,wallet)!: Transitive ChainPosition
  • Sqlite - allow persisting anchor without tx
  • Check time when persisting in rusqlite impl
  • fix(core): Fix checkpoint Drop stack overflow
  • Use bitcoin::constants::COINBASE_MATURITY
HWI
  • add Trezor Safe 3 and Safe 5 to device support matrix table
  • Add BitBox02 Simulator
rust-bitcoin
  • Explicitly define Ord for NodeInfo
  • units: test for C-SEND-SYNC
  • Add API scripts and output files
  • Change Amount::MAX from u64::MAX to Amount::MAX_MONEY
  • Close amounts error types
  • Add string regression tests in leaf crates
  • units: Remove serde from amounts
  • Fix internal weight calculation
  • Account for data pushing opcodes in is_standard_op_return
  • Fix psbt fuzz crash
  • Deprecate iwp weight
  • units: Add integration test of API surface
  • Re-design and move Block to primitives
  • Remove From and Into test impls and create test-specific function for converting between Rust primitives and U256
  • transaction: Add plural field getters
  • Fix bug in witness stack getters
  • Split checked_div_by_weight into floor and ceiling version
  • Fix bip34 number parsing for Block
  • Improve the amount module
  • Update rust-bitcoin-maintainer-tools
  • script: remove unsafe marker from slice-to-script conversions
  • Introduce impl_bytelike_traits macro
libsecp
  • Clear sensitive memory without getting optimized out (revival of #636)
  • Name public API structs
Core Lightning
  • Release v24.11
  • onionmessage forward fail notification
  • Quieten gossipd
  • xpay maxfee fix
  • decode: don't fail to decode just because a bolt12 invoice has expired.
  • Enable seeker autoconnect when started with no peers, disable when --offline
  • connectd: fix crash when we get an incoming conn while outgoing attempt is ratelimited
  • gossipd: fix crash in seeker rotation code.
  • connectd: force our own channel gossip to more peers
  • Anchor code cleanup: always use anchors, but only boost to estimateblockfee 12.
  • Fix: don't send anchorspends for onchain commitment txs
  • Handle connection better: make connectd know which peers are important
  • common: Add a debug mode for tracing
  • Xpay: add one to CLTV blockheight
  • pyln-client: restore backwards compatibility with CLN prior to 24.08
  • Seeker autoconnect
  • tests: add pay test over unannounced channels
  • askrene: improving the MCF solver
  • lightningd: tell gossipd channel is closed if it tells us about our channel and is wrong.
  • Aggressive Gossip Seeker
  • Splice Interop
  • Fix offer payment failure
  • bolt12: allow to inject payer_metadata
  • Offers: Not just for breakfast anymore!
  • xpay: a rewritten payment plugin using askrene and injectpaymentonion
  • New RPC command listaddresses
  • close: Print multiple txs; Fixes #6467
  • Agressive Channeld Restart Testing
  • bookkeeper testing for splice-in + splice-out
  • lightningd: deprecate decodepay.
  • hsmtool.c - Added new method to enable creation of hsm_file from cmd-line args
  • onchaind: replay using real block data, not db
  • exposesecret: a way to back up the hsm_secret via rpc (if enabled!)
  • Add strict-forwarding option
  • add listing options to listpays
  • Add RPCs to bookkeeper so you can update/set a description on an event
  • splice: Script for complex splices
  • Askrene refinements: better documentation, channel biases
  • Fakechanneld for testing against real topology.
  • renepay: pay BOLT11 invoices with description_hash
  • bolt12: fix typo about parameters name in err str
  • gossipd: Correct evaluation of new channel announcement timestsamp
eclair
  • Remove obsolete WatchFundingConfirmed when using RBF
  • Decrypt on-the-fly funding trampoline failures
  • Properly type Sphinx shared secrets
  • Refactor Sphinx failures
  • Check HTLC output status before funding HTLC tx
  • Various refactoring for trampoline blinded paths
  • Rename blinding to pathKey
  • Refactor trampoline-to-legacy payments
  • Allow plain outgoing_node_id in blinded payment_relay
  • Simplify trampoline test helpers
  • Update Bitcoin Core to 27.2
  • Add logs for balance estimate
  • Add force-close notification
  • Make cluster serialization support unknown messages
  • Don't relay buggy extra payments
LDK
  • Support Trampoline flag in BOLT12 invoices
  • Persist unresolved ChannelMonitors on empty height change
  • Misc updates to tee up async ChannelMonitorUpdate persist for claims against closed channels
  • Gossip filtration fix
  • Add the ability to fetch a probability from live liquidity bounds
  • Stop sending channel_update in onion failures
  • Expand on RGS caching requirements
  • Document RGS timestamp usage
  • Implement accepting dual-funded channels without contributing
  • Follow-ups for ChannelManager::create_bolt11_invoice
  • Don't interpret decayed data as we've failed to send tiny values
  • Disallow user-provided payer_signing_pubkey
  • Support paying directly to Human Readable Names using bLIP 32
  • Verify blinded keysend payments
  • Add ChannelManager::create_bolt11_invoice
  • Experimental offer TLVs
  • Re-broadcast channel_announcements every six blocks for a week
  • Include invoice requests in async payment onions
  • Drop dead code from provide_latest_counterparty_commitment_tx
lnd
  • (3/4) - lnwallet/chancloser: add new protofsm based RBF chan closer
  • routing: fix mc blinded path behaviour.
  • lnrpc: sort Invoice.HTLCs based on HtlcIndex
  • (custom channels): refactor AuxTrafficManager to be used for forwarding as well
  • Don't block on channel arbitator startup
  • chainreg: use feerate estimator in regtest and simnet
  • cmd: fix default timeout for estimateroutefee
  • (1/3) Graph RIP: refactor+graph: move all graph related DB code to the graph package
  • DynComms (1/n): Implement Quiescence Protocol
  • Add Experimental Endorsement Signalling
  • pagination: add pagination to wallet transactions
  • localchans: recreate missing edge if not found
  • lnwallet: log the amounts in the same unit
  • lnd: stop graphBuilder during shutdown
  • (custom channels): add taproot overlay channel type to channel acceptor
  • fix chanArb deadlock
  • peer+lnd: fix peer blocking on node shutdown
  • multi: generate and pass along HTLC resolution blobs for aux channels
  • routerrpc: fix sendpayment_v2 negative fee limit
  • multi: fix rpcclient shutdown
  • htlcswitch: merge htlc custom records on modify
  • Deprecate dust-threshold config value
  • Cancel back outgoing dust htlcs before commitment is confirmed.
  • lnrpc: return meaningful response instead of empty one
  • Add maxFeeRatio parameter to sanityCheckFee in psbt coin selection
  • (walletrpc): add sat_per_kw fee option to FundPsbt RPC
  • routing+migration32: update migration 32 to use pure TLV encoding for mission control results
BIPs
  • BIP-373: denote different public key types/purposes consistently
  • BIP125: update status to Final
  • BIP‚ÄØ348: OP_CHECKSIGFROMSTACK
  • Add BIP‚ÄØ349: OP_INTERNALKEY
  • BIP373: Clarify where keys in MuSig fields may appear in the Taproot output
  • BIP390: Clarify that musig cannot be used in top-level pk() or pkh()
BLIPs
  • Update bLIP 32 to point to BOLT 12 for name/domain inclusion
BOLTs
  • Include BIP 353 name info in invoice_requests
  • Add a generic Code of Conduct

Oportunidades educativas o laborales

  • Bitcoiner Jobs
  • Summer of Bitcoin
  • B4OS
  • Chaincode Labs: Bitcoin and Lightning Protocol Development Education

item.title: Seminario Socr√°tico #0
item.author: Unknown
item.description:
Agenda

18:30hs Previa con man√≠ y cerveza
19:00hs Seminario Socr√°tico donde revisamos m√∫ltiples temas relacionados con Bitcoin
20:00hs Cierre

Ubicaci√≥n

El evento se organiza dentro del espacio de Bitcoin School Argentina:

Bv. Chacabuco 625
1¬∫ piso, Sal√≥n Principal
C√≥rdoba, Argentina X5000

Map

Anuncios

Estamos muy felices de introducir nuestro primer Seminario Socr√°tico! Un especial agradecimiento a nuestros sponsors Bitcoin School Argentina por el espacio y a B4OS por las bebidas.

Recordatorios

  • No se permiten fotograf√≠as, v√≠deos o grabaciones de audio
  • Nos adherimos a "the Chatham House Rule"
  • Deja el espacio del encuentro tan limpio como lo encontraste.
  • Sugiere temas para el siguiente Seminario Socr√°tico! ¬øDonde encontrar temas para futuros seminarios?

Temas

Estad√≠sticas de la Red

  • mempool.space
  • clarkmoody.com

Eventos

  • bitcoin++: Florian√≥polis
  • TABConf7

Nuevos oficinas de desarrollo

  • 2140 in Europe
  • Localhost Research in San Francisco

Noticias

  • Telekom tests Bitcoin mining with surplus energy
  • Namecheap processes 1.1m transactions with BTCPay

Lanzamientos

  • Bitcoin Core 28.0
  • Zeus White
  • Lightspark unveils an L2 using statechains
  • Boltz BOLT 12 Swaps
  • BTCPay Server 2.0: our biggest update yet!, video

Hardware wallets

  • Bitkey featured in Time's best inventions of 2024
  • Bitkey Whitepaper

Miner√≠a

  • Introducing Proto: Building the future of bitcoin mining hardware

Estado

  • Bitcoin Act 2024

Financiaci√≥n

  • Blockstream raises $210M from Fulgur etc.
  • Report: Building Bitcoin - Funding a $1.2 Trillion Dollar Project

Recursos

  • Guide for Wallets Employing Bitcoin Core 28.0 Policies
  • EmailBTC
  • BitVMX website
  • Bitcoin Balance API
  • Fabric, DNS resolver for spaces
  • Battle of Galen Erso
  • Libbitcoin for Core people

Curiosidades

  • Satoshi9000 random number generator

Lightning

  • LN Summit 2024 Notes & Summary/Commentary
  • 0 fee lightning tx

Sincronizaci√≥n de la cadena

  • libbitcoin syncs full blockchain in 1 hour

Runas e inscripciones

  • Runes mint timelapse
  • BRC20 Pinning Attack

Silent Payments

  • Bitcoin Design Guide: Silent Payments

Post Quantum

  • QuBit - P2QRH spending rules
  • Post Quantum Sigs with GSR - Delving Post

Censura

  • Payment Censorship in the Lightning Network Despite Encrypted Communication, delvingbitcoin post, calle tweet

Escalamiento

  • OPR - Offchain Payment Resolution Protocol
  • SuperScalar: Laddered Timeout-Tree-Structured Decker-Wattenhofer Factories
  • CAT Protocol

M√°s alla del c√≥digo

  • The distributional consequences of Bitcoin
  • BCAP: Analyzing Bitcoin Consensus: Risks in Protocol Upgrades, Steve's bcap tweet thread

Criptograf√≠a

  • Adaptors generalized
  • DLEQ BIP Draft

Revelaci√≥n de vulnerabilidades

  • CVE-2024-38365 public disclosure (btcd FindAndDelete bug)
  • Disclosure of CVE-2024-35202
  • Disclosure of DoS due to inv-to-send sets growing too large
  • Disclosure of hindered block propagation due to mutated blocks
  • Disclosure of hindered block propagation due to stalling peers

Repositorios

  • rust-bitcoin: Support Testnet4 Network #2945
  • rust-bitcoin: Add version three variant to transaction version #3450
  • rust-bitcoin: Add the ChaCha20Poly1305 AEAD algorithm #2960
  • bitcoin-core/secp256k1: Add module "musig" that implements MuSig2 multi-signatures (BIP 327) #1479
  • bitcoin-core: Drop miniupnp dependency #31130
  • bitcoin-core: Remove mempoolfullrbf #30592
  • core-lightning: pay: Remember and update channel_hints across payments #7494
  • lnd: cmd: allow deterministic macaroon derivation with lncli #9172
  • Eclair: Add support for RBF-ing splice transactions #2925
  • LDK: Add the core functionality required to resolve Human Readable Names #3179
  • LDK: Re-broadcast channel_announcements every six blocks for a week #3360
  • LDK: Include invoice requests in async payment onions
  • LDK: Support paying directly to Human Readable Names using bLIP 32 #3283

Oportunidades educativas o laborales

  • Bitcoiner Jobs
  • Summer of Bitcoin
  • B4OS
  • Chaincode Labs: Bitcoin and Lightning Protocol Development Education
